Class AgendaChangingPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • AgendaChangingPoint

  • public class AgendaChangingPoint
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a test class for Merge two different phone agendas Imagine that you need to organize a party and to create a guest list. You're adding alphabetically all your friends from your phone agenda in a huge array you create in memory (you have a lot of friends). You start your list with your best friend who is somewhere in the middle of your agenda. When you've reached the end of the agenda, you start from the beginning and do the same thing until you reach your best friend.

    Now you have an array of names that are mostly alphabetical, except they start somewhere in the middle of the alphabet, reach the end, and start from the beginning of the alphabet.

    The objective is finding the index of the "changing point," which is where you start adding guests from the beginning of your agenda.

    Author:
    Luis Barreira

    • Method Detail

      • charAtIdxisLower

        private static boolean charAtIdxisLower(java.lang.String str1,
                                        java.lang.String str2,
                                        int idx)
        Returns true if the 2th string is alphabetical lower then the 1th string. This method will either (depending on IN_DEPTH_ANALYSIS flag) just compares the first character of the string, or recursively compares the complete string character by character
        Parameters:
        str1 - the first string to compare
        str2 - the second string to compare
        idx - the current string character index to compare
        Returns:
        true if the second string is lower then the first

      • getChangingPoint

        private static int getChangingPoint(java.lang.String[] strList)
        Returns the array index at which a changing point in alphabetic sorting happens.
        Parameters:
        strList - the string array containing both agendas names, each agenda sorted alphabetically
        Returns:
        the array index at which the second agenda is detected, the changing point

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to find the changing point in 2 agendas
        Parameters:
        args - the command line argument. [0] (optional) -d for activating In Depth Analysis [1..n] Each position is a different name of the agenda.
